ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Global Repository
MWS2R2 - AD Rename Computer
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# ScriptName: AD Rename Computer # Author: Mark Freeman # Required Variables: COMPONENTID, INSTANCEID # Description: # # Renames a computer based on MWS2 naming standard # Registers the computername and IP address in the key value store # Downloads common and computer specific files from the deployment file share # Resets the local administrator account password to a random value # Registers the password in the key value share # Updates the instance name in Cloud Provider # # 2015/05/21 DRidley -Updated Rename Computer section to check if IstanceID has already been deployed
. .\GlobalRepository.ps1
$ComponentID = $COMPONENTID $InstanceID = $INSTANCEID $DomainFQDN = (get-globalvariable("Global\DomainFQDN")).value
$CustomerID = (get-globalvariable "Global/CustomerID").value $LocationID = (get-globalvariable "Global/LocationID").value
# Set Primary & Secondary DNS on active NIC. This is required to check if InstanceID has already been deployed $PrimaryDNS = (get-globalvariable("AD\PrimaryDNS")).value $SecondaryDNS = (get-globalvariable("AD\SecondaryDNS")).value $NICindex = Get-NetAdapter -physical | where status -eq 'up' | Select 'Name' -ExpandProperty ifIndex Write-Output "Setting $PrimaryDNS and $SecondaryDNS as DNS servers on active NIC" Set-DNSClientServerAddress -InterfaceIndex $NICindex -ServerAddresses ($PrimaryDNS,$SecondaryDNS)
# Rename Computer $Computername = $($CustomerID + $ComponentID + $LocationID + $InstanceID + "W") Write-Output "Checking if $Computername has been previously deployed..." If (Test-Connection -Computername "$Computername.$DomainFQDN" -Count 2 -Quiet) { Write-Output "ERROR: $Computername is already deployed! Exiting..." EXIT 1 } Else { Write-Output "$ComponentID-$InstanceID does not appear to have been previously deployed. Continuing..." Write-Output "Setting computername to $Computername" Rename-Computer -NewName $Computername -force }
write-output "Storing IP Address in key value store" $key = 'Network/{0}' -f $Computername $ip = Get-NetIPAddress | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.AddressFamily -eq "IPv4" } | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.IPAddress -ne "127.0.0.1"} $ipa = $ip.IPAddress Set-globalvariable $key $ipa
write-output "Downloading common files and computer files from repository"
get-files "$ComponentID$InstanceID"
write-output "Resetting local administrator password" . .\New-RandomPassword.ps1 $password = new-randompassword -PasswordLength 10 $adminUser = [ADSI] "WinNT://./SOE-LOAD,User" $adminUser.SetPassword($password) Set-globalvariable "Administrator/$Computername" $password
#register name tag #write-output "Registering AWS name tag" #$aid = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/instance-id #$uri = "http://10.0.0.23:5000/p1/" + $aid + "?tagname=" + $Computername #Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $uri -Method Put
write-output "Restarting computer"

ns1:variable.ns1:name: COMPONENTID
ns1:variable.ns1:description: COMPONENTID

ns1:variable.ns1:name: INSTANCEID
ns1:variable.ns1:description: INSTANCEID

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Add To Domain
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# ScriptName: AD Add to Domain # Author: Mark Freeman # Required Variables: None # Description: # # Adds a computer to the MWS2 Resource Domain
. .\GlobalRepository.ps1
$domainname = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainFQDN").value $domainNB = (get-globalvariable "Global\DomainNetBIOS").value $short_username = (get-globalvariable "Global\DeploymentUsername").value $username = "$domainNB\$short_username" $password = (get-globalvariable "Global\DeploymentPassword").value $dn = (get-globalvariable "AD\DistinguishedName").value
$pdns = (get-globalvariable "AD\PrimaryDNS").value $sdns = (get-globalvariable "AD\SecondaryDNS").value
$computername = $env:COMPUTERNAME $ouPath = "OU=servers,OU=customer,$dn"
if ($computername.ToLower().Contains("dbs")){ $ouPath="OU=Database,$ouPath" }
if ($computername.ToLower().Contains("mas")){ $ouPath="OU=Exchange,$ouPath" }
$na=Get-NetAdapter -Physical | where status -eq 'up' Set-DnsClientServerAddress -InterfaceIndex $na.ifIndex -ServerAddresses ($pdns,$sdns)
$secure_pwd = convertto-securestring $password -asplaintext -force $djcred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ` -argumentlist $username, $secure_pwd
Add-Computer -DomainName $domainname -Credential $djcred -OUPath $ouPath -Force write-output "Joined domain."

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - AD Rename and Add to Domain
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:publishComment: removed product specific defaults from the package variables

ns1:variable.ns1:name: COMPONENTID
ns1:variable.ns1:description: COMPONENTID

ns1:variable.ns1:description: Maximum size of PageFile in MB

ns1:variable.ns1:name: INITIALSIZEMB
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Initial size of PageFile in MB

ns1:variable.ns1:name: PAGEFILEPATH
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Location and filename of PageFile

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - Set Volume Label
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:description: Change the label of one or more volumes.

ns1:variable.ns1:name: DISKLABELS
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Drive letter and labels

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - Get App Files
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:description: Copies application files from the nominated network share to the target VM.
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# MWS2 - Get App Files ############################################################## # Author: Marina Krynina # Desc: Deploys installation files onto the target server ############################################################################################
# Mandatory heading # Load Common functions . .\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\VariableUtility.ps1 . .\FilesUtility.ps1 . .\LaunchProcess.ps1
######################################################################### # Main # - Deploys installation files onto the target server ######################################################################### try { $scriptPath = $env:USERPROFILE . .\LoggingV2.ps1 $true $scriptPath "GetAppFiles.ps1"
log "INFO: Getting variables values or setting defaults if the variables are not populated." $sourceFolders = (Get-VariableValue $SOURCE "" $false)
foreach($srcFolder in ($sourceFolders.Replace(" ", "")).Split(",")) { log "INFO: Deploying $srcFolder folder onto the target VM" get-appfiles $srcFolder }
log "INFO: Finished $msg."
exit 0 } catch { $ex = $_.Exception | format-list | Out-String log "ERROR: Exception occurred `nException Message: $ex"
exit 1 }

ns1:variable.ns1:name: SOURCE
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Folder on a network share where install files and supporting scripts are stored. The content of the folder will be copied onto a target server.

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - Extract App Files
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:description: Extracts ISO, ZIP application files using 7zip in the given folder including subfolders
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# MWS2R2 - Extract App Files ############################################################### # Author: Marina Krynina # Desc: Extracts application files (ISO, ZIP) ############################################################################################
# Mandatory heading # Load Common functions . .\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\VariableUtility.ps1 . .\FilesUtility.ps1 . .\LaunchProcess.ps1
######################################################################### # Main ######################################################################### try { # Folder structure in the Global Repository # \Global Repository # \$SOURCE, folder name in the Global Repository
# Folder structure on VM # C:\Users\InstallerAccount # \$INSTALL_MEDIA - the content of the isntall media will be extracted here
$scriptPath = $env:USERPROFILE . .\LoggingV2.ps1 $true $scriptPath "ExtractAppFiles.ps1"
log "INFO: Getting variables values or setting defaults if the variables are not populated." $installMedia = (Get-VariableValue $INSTALL_MEDIA "" $false)
# Extracting $msg = "Extracting application installation files" log "INFO: Starting $msg"
# 7za920.exe does not support ISO files, 7z.exe does. # 7z files are located in the Common folder and copied by default $extractionTool = "$scriptPath\7z.exe"
foreach($srcFolder in ($installMedia.Replace(" ", "")).Split(",")) {
if (([string]::IsNullOrEmpty($installMedia)) -eq $true) { $installMediaSource = "$scriptPath" } else { $installMediaSource = "$scriptPath\$srcFolder" }
Extract $extractionTool $installMediaSource }
log "INFO: Finished $msg."
exit 0 } catch { $ex = $_.Exception | format-list | Out-String log "ERROR: Exception occurred `nException Message: $ex"
exit 1 }

ns1:variable.ns1:name: INSTALL_MEDIA
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Folder name where installation media is located.

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - OWA 2013 Install

ns1:variable.ns1:name: INSTALL_MEDIA
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Name of the folder containing product installation files

ns1:variable.ns1:name: CONFIG_XML
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Configuration file used by installer

ns1:variable.ns1:name: PIDKEY
ns1:variable.ns1:description: License key

ns1:variable.ns1:name: INSTALLLOCATION

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - OWA 2013 Install
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:description: Gets app files from "OfficeWebApps2013", extarcts the install files and Installs OWA 2013 server

ns1:variable.ns1:name: INSTALL_MEDIA
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Subfolder name within the SOURCE folder where product related install files are located (Package default)

ns1:variable.ns1:name: SOURCE
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Folder name on the deploy server where product related install files and scripts are located (Package default)

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - Common SSL Import Certirifcates
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:description: Imports SSL certificates based on a configuration file
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# Script: Import SSL certificates # Author: Marina Krynina ################################################################################################# try { $scriptPath = $env:USERPROFILE . .\LoggingV2.ps1 $true $scriptPath "Import-Certificates.ps1" . .\Import-Certificates.ps1 $scriptPath exit 0 } catch { $ex = $_.Exception | format-list | Out-String log "ERROR: Exception occurred `nException Message: $ex"
exit 1 }

ns1:variable.ns1:name: USE_VARIABLES
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Flag to indicate if Agility variables should be used by the script

ns1:variable.ns1:name: ADMIN
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Administrator account name

ns1:variable.ns1:name: CERTS_XML
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Location of the certificates xml

ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - OWA 2013 Configure
ns1:pendingAsset.ns1:body:
# MWS2R2 - OWA 2013 Configure ################################################################## # Author: Marina Krynina ################################################################################################# # \USER_PROFILE # \Install # \Config # \InstallMedia # \OWA2013SP1x64 # \Logs
try { Write-host "INFO: Starting script execution"
$scriptPath = $env:USERPROFILE . .\LoggingV2.ps1 $true $scriptPath "Execute-OWA2013Configuration.ps1" . .\Config\Execute-OWA2013Configuration.ps1
exit 0 } catch { $ex = $_.Exception | format-list | Out-String Write-host "ERROR: Exception occurred `nException Message: $ex"
exit 1 }

ns1:variable.ns1:name: INTERNAL_URL
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Specifies the URL root that clients use to access the Office Web Apps Server farm from the intranet. Must match DNS.

ns1:variable.ns1:name: EXTERNAL_URL
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Specifies the URL root that clients use to access the Office Web Apps Server farm from the Internet. In the case of a load-balanced, multiserver Office Web Apps Server farm, the external URL is bound to the IP address of the external-facing load balancer.

ns1:variable.ns1:name: CONFIG_XML
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Configuration XML

ns1:variable.ns1:name: ADMIN
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Admin user name

ns1:variable.ns1:name: RENDERING_CACHE_LOCATION
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Specifies the location of the temporary cache for use by the Word and PowerPoint Viewing Services

ns1:variable.ns1:name: LOG_LOCATION
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Specifies the location on the local computer where activity logs are stored.

ns1:variable.ns1:name: CACHE_LOCATION
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Specifies the location of the global disk cache that is used to store rendered image files

ns1:variable.ns1:name: PRIMARY_SERVER
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Primary server pf the Ofiice Web App 2013 farm

ns1:variable.ns1:name: CERTIFICATE_NAME
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Specifies the friendly name of the certificate that Office Web Apps Server uses to create HTTPS bindings.

ns1:variable.ns1:name: CERTS_XML
ns1:variable.ns1:description: SSL certification details
